caption:
Hey, CS/DS/AI Majors! Have feedback about your student experience? Enjoy some pizza and share your concerns about coursework, academic and career resources, office hours, community, and more at our Student Forum on October 16th in SCHM 113!

Open to both West Lafayette and Indianapolis students!

Make sure to RSVP with the QR code or through this link (also in our Link Tree!) :

http://bit.ly/4oyCid5

We hope to see you there!!

Curious about where CS can take you? Join us for the CS Tracks Panel on Oct 21st, 7:30‚Äì9 PM in Lawson Commons! Hear from upperclassmen about their experiences in different CS tracks, get your questions answered, and enjoy free food!

Reserve your spot with the QR code above or the link in bio!

Join the CS Undergraduate Student Board for an engaging Pizza with Professor session featuring Professor Turkstra! Professor Turkstra will share insights about his teaching philosophy, research interests, and experiences in the field of computer science.

Bring your questions and get ready for an interactive discussion!

üìÖ Date: 20th October 2025
‚è∞ Time: 5:00pm to 6:00pm
üìç Location: WALC B093

RSVP now and don‚Äôt miss out on this opportunity to learn, network, and, of course, eat pizza! You can RSVP with the link below or find it in our bio.

RSVP at https://tinyurl.com/pizzawithprofessorturkstra

Need help in CS 193, 180, 182, or 240? USB‚Äôs Help Room is designed to serve as additional office hours for core CS curriculum.

Debugging late at night and struggling to find a solution? Studying for an exam and having some last-minute questions? Our team of tutors is here to help you out! We have tutors working from Monday to Thursday, offering both virtual (Zoom) and in-person (DSAI lobby) sessions.

If you want more information or want to see the schedule for Help Room, go to purdueusb.com//wiki/help-room, scan the qr code, or visit the link in our bio.

If you have any questions about Help Room, reach out to liu3688@purdue.edu and tsze@purdue.edu

Hey CS/DS/AI Freshmen!

Looking to meet new people and connect with your classmates? Come join us for Game Night in the Lawson Commons on 9/30!

We‚Äôll have a ton of games in a relaxed, welcoming setting, including Mario Kart on the Lawson screen, jenga, cards, and more! There will also be free pizza!

If you‚Äôre interested, make sure to scan the QR code or visit the link in our bio to RSVP!

Are you passionate about helping others succeed, or just looking to give back to the CS/DS/AI community? As a mentor for USB, you‚Äôll guide incoming freshmen through their transition to college life. Mentors provide advice on academics, campus resources, and getting involved, while also offering support and encouragement along the way. Share your experiences, answer questions, and help new students feel confident, connected, and ready to thrive.
Make a difference in someone‚Äôs college journey ‚Äî sign up to be a mentor today via the QR code or the link: https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfdMPSUWsInx0LCsnfFbLybcRDFvxYE5bLrEvkRVnxMsVVUqg/viewform
